rows.text_1:
Today we are learning about spending one-on-one time with your child. 

Spending dedicated, special, time with your child will make them feel valued and loved.
It will also build trust and respect, and support their learning.
rows.media_title: How will it help me and my family?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings!, everyone.

It turns out that oOur children don’t need lots ofexpensive gifts. The best gift we can give them is to spend one-on-one time with them.

By SsSpending time together just the two of you, will help you to you will understand your child better and help them to they will learn many new things.

Having thisspecial time together with your child will feel special because it will help them feel loved and valued. And tThat will make everything easier at home!

rows.text_1:
One-on-oOne tTime can be fun for both of you!you and your child.

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name do this!

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “Wonderful idea, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it.”

@data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name finds a dress to wear.
 @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “Well done for getting that dress on by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. You’re learning to do so many new things for yourself!”

rows.quiz_3_feedback_1: Yes! Spending time with our children helps us to connect with them. We can enjoy time together without also trying to do chores or workt.
rows.quiz_3_feedback_2: Yes! Spending time with our children helps us to connect with them. We can enjoy time together without also trying to do chores or work.
rows.quiz_3_feedback_3: Yes! Spending time with our children helps us to connect with them. We can enjoy time together without also trying to do chores or work.

rows.text_1: Here are some easy tips on how to connect with your child when you spend time together:
rows.section_1_text: Spend at least 5 minutes with your child each day. More is better!
rows.section_2_text: Switch off the TV, put aside phones, and remove distractions. Show your child that you are really paying attention to them.
rows.section_2_extra_text:
- Look at your child. Get down to their level. Use their name.
- Describe what they are doing and feeling. Praise them.
- Your child will learn a lot from what you say and do.
rows.section_3_text:
Ask to spend time with your child. Let them choose what to do or talk about. 
Try different activities together. Have fun!
rows.section_3_extra_text: This will help your child feel important and valued.

rows.text_1:
Ready to try it out? 

Spend 5 minutes (or more) of one-on-one time with your child, every day.
rows.media_title: How it helped a parent like you:
rows.media_transcript:
When I first heard I have to spend one-on-one time with my daughter, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my daughter so that she thinks we have to do everything together. 
But I really wanted to build my relationship with her and I wanted her to open up about what was troubling her. 
So we tried the One-on-One Time. 
First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we play her favourite game together and talk about things happening at school and with her friends.

rows.quiz_1_question: How will you spend one-on-one time with your child today?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1:
Great idea!

Do you every feel like you have NO TIME and are exhausted? We’ve all been there! Try to think of ways to make daily activities fun together.
